website_summaries.verdict: A versatile board for both exercise and therapeutic purposes.
pros: Works well for a variety of exercises and positions
cons: some users suggest that it would be more effective if it were a bit larger

customer_reviews.title: As effective as a plastic brick...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to continue physical therapy at home after insurance stopped paying for PT sessions. Returned it immediately, as it was fairly easy to maintaim one's balance due to the nearly flat angle of the rocker's bottom surface. I ended up buying a rocker board made by Fitter First, which provided a more challenging exercise due to it being less steady--on top of it, the incline angle/difficulty setting can be easily adjusted with a simple twist and pull. If you buy this and share a similar experience, don't say I didn't warn you!
customer_reviews.author: NYMarksman

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my Balance Board
customer_reviews.text: Helps me regain my balance and works those leg muscles out! As with all exercise equipment have a chair or table to grab onto if your balance is compromised, this balance board does work well and I have noticed and improvement.
customer_reviews.author: homegirl

customer_reviews.title: Keeping in Balance
customer_reviews.text: I first used a wobble board like this, in a physical therapy setting, for a bad back and some balance issues. I like the Theraband version because of the quality of its construction. It is a challenge to balance on it, but the benefits of improved core strength and overall improvement in balance made it worth the money to have one at home so that I can do my exercises here. Wonderful item.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Donald

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.text: After my son's numerous sports ankle injuries, the physical therapist started using this wobble board on him as part of his treatment. The treatment was so successful that my son wanted one for himself. We got this for him and continued his own therapy almost on a daily basis. He strengthened his ankles to the point of not getting anymore injuries on them. A high school athlete who played baseball, football and basketball, no more problems with the ankles. Worth the money and useful for other forms of exercise. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: teammendy

customer_reviews.title: but I quickly became used to it - an excellent balance product
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the PT studio where I pay $50/ a shot to strengthen my ankle (loose joint). It was hard to balance on at first, but I quickly became used to it - an excellent balance product. I stand on it while watching TV. I am not "fit" so if I can do it, you can too.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stout

customer_reviews.title: Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price! I learned about this item at the physical therapy place. I bought myself the item to use at home. It is so well made that I feel no fear of it breaking on me. There is an instruction book that comes with it. There were more exercises in it than what I was learning. I showed it to the Pt Dr., and she was impressed. We followed more of those exercises listed. I use mine every day to other day and it is so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M Skulason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little on the pricey side but it's well worth it. This is the same product my physical therapist uses which is where I got the reference from. It's very durable and has a slip resistant pad which is great for balancing and stretching.
customer_reviews.author: NateTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Ongoing Therapy
customer_reviews.text: After being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease I noticed some disturbing balance issues. Physical Therapy did wonders and the Thera-Band Rocker Board played a big part and is part of my regular in house PT routine. It's like operating a Segway. Makes a difference in my confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Xcaliber

customer_reviews.title: and I recommend it for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This balance board is much easier to work with than the Fury Fitness wooden board, and I recommend it for beginners. The base on this board is wider and at first it's rough on the feet. But since I own both boards the Fury works as a more advanced wobble board.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Alex
customer_reviews.text: It is all that I asked for and expected. It is the same one in my doctor office for therapy. I could have got something much cheaper, but did not to chance low quality and perhaps dangerous junk, as I could get hurt. It is very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best co for Pt products
customer_reviews.text: My PT had this and I used it to strengthen my ankle but my husband used it w arm weights to strengthen his core. Safe bends forward and backward and is not too wobbly especially if you hold a railing.
customer_reviews.author: Anne McFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Its so versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Its so versatile. You can do lots of different exercises and stretches using this. It really works the core.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A.

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for physical therpay exercise following foot surgery. It is large and sturdy, I use it twice a day for stretching and flexing the ligaments in my feet. It has helped reduce the plantar fascitis pain significantly. It is expensive, but considering that I will be using it daily from now on, more than worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: toni

customer_reviews.title: A llittle advanced for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm older and I feel safer holding on to the counter when I use this. I like it; sturdy, large enough to feel secure in my stance. It would probably be perfect for someone more advanced than I. The nubs are distinct enough that I don't slip. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Jinnman

customer_reviews.title: Great product to revoker from a broken ankle
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this so I can do my exercises/rehab at home and recover faster from a broken ankle. This is the same product that my physical therapist have recommended for my rehab at home since its the same one they use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: It is great to be able to work on it in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I was grateful to find this product. I recently had reconstructive surgery on ,my ankle and my surgeon wanted me to work on this through physical therapy. It is great to be able to work on it in my own home.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Use it at my stand up desk!
customer_reviews.text: I've got good balance so I've been using it at my stand-up desk for hours at a time. Instead of locking my legs I have constant motion. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: A to P rocking is easy - lateral rocking is a little hard for most ...
customer_reviews.text: More narrow than I thought it would be. A to P rocking is easy - lateral rocking is a little hard for most of my patients to do - getting on the board with the lateral rock motion is difficult - but once on the board it's ok. The board also creaks & sounds like it's going to break, even with average sized women using it.
customer_reviews.author: kristen315

customer_reviews.title: Rocker Board
customer_reviews.text: Are use this after having a total ankle replacement and it worked well are used it in physical therapy and then used a daily at home
customer_reviews.author: Marion Wilson

customer_reviews.title: My therapist feels that it should be a bit bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: My therapist feels that it should be a bit bigger to get the most benefit. Still, she was able to give me some exercises (squats and balances) for it to do at home. She cautioned that the board rocks VERY far right and left and suggested that I put rolled up towels on either side to buffer the tilt somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: E. LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: rocker board is great
customer_reviews.text: The rocker board is greater than my expectations, I purchased one for I had total knee replacement surgery and we used it in therapy. It is said to help with ones balance and I hope to XC Ski again very soon and this will help. What I did not know is that there are other workouts that you can do with it so the workout booklet that comes with it was appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: A Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I used a similar wooden product during a recent session of PT, but found the birch wood product to be far more expensive when researching to purchase a balance board. This board works just as well and is light-weight and sturdy. Great for us older folks trying to keep in shape and in balance.
customer_reviews.author: Loves to Cook

customer_reviews.title: It's a great wobble board
customer_reviews.text: Use this daily at work with my adjustable desk. It's a great wobble board, just wish it was a little bit bigger so that I could have a wider leg stance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Home therapy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my order...quality piece and easy to lift when headed upstairs or outside. This is a bit smaller than what I used in knee therapy, but the result is exactly the same. Using this to strengthen knee and ankle and improve balance... Not sure if the directions stressed to bend your knees slightly or set a timer for 1-3 minutes each way, but that works wonders!
customer_reviews.author: MOMZ

customer_reviews.title: Great wobble board
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wobble board that I have seen. As a chiropractor, I have 3 wobble boards. This is a great one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Construction of product is sturdy. Been using it for the past weeks and see great improvement in my balance. I am a SCI patient and balancing is tough for me but not after using Wobble Board. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun and reasonably easy enough for my old fat self to do. Of course my kid can dance on it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Petronio

customer_reviews.title: A great device
customer_reviews.text: I use this at Physical Therapy for plantar fasciitis- it's a fab device to have at home as well. I use it for calf stretches, as well as balance and proprioception training. Well made, durable, and sturdy- I'm thrilled! Lots of new ideas for exercises inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Great for stability and balance training
customer_reviews.text: I used this in physical therapy on my ankle. I bought for home use. Great for stability and balance training. Will help strengthen knees too. Also good to stretch out calves.
customer_reviews.author: MKP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Good Product. Works better than one used by therapist.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. We like it except if doesn't go as far to either side to test our balance as the ones in the therapy office. Still a good challenge for balance.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Rocker radius and centering flat eliminate any therapeutic benefit
customer_reviews.text: The radius of the rocker is too shallow and has a relatively flat spot to assist centering. This might be a good design for some people but I was looking for something more challenging. This version is way too easy and not useful in building balance and control. On the upside it seems well made and should provide many years of no-utility.
customer_reviews.author: @Mooniac

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these at PT. after my sess ended, I bought this to continue stretching at home. It works great and stores easily under the sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Fozzy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Works really good to stretch broken ankle later in healing process. Very sturdy - does not tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a balanced review !
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price, fast delivery . It works and it befriended me and I befriended it and it is now my daily partner . The whole process- from finding and receiving it until trying and mastering it was fast and smooth
customer_reviews.author: Barry Chazan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: I have searched for a high quality Rocker Board, and this definitely fills that requirement. It's a bit on the pricy side, but worth every penny for sure. It's almost like the one my Physical Therapist has. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Karenann

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: A doctor suggested I use a wobble board in the rehab of my broken ankles. This board is solid and well-designed, as the bumpy surface offers adequate traction whether you are barefoot (may be too much for some), in socks, or wearing running shoes. I use it on a thick rug so the wobbling is more controlled. Very helpful for regaining leg and ankle strength!
customer_reviews.author: Criticalthinker

customer_reviews.title: I have balance issues and and using this board to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have balance issues and and using this board to try and learn to compensate for my balance issues. It is exactly as described and I am hoping that it will help me.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: I also like using this for exercise great product @ a great ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my mom who is in physical therapy at the request of her therapist. She loves it does it almost everyday, she has 77. I also like using this for exercise great product @ a great price. Also recommended it to others at physical therapy and gave them the website . thank you Leslie
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Built
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure they have a well educated PT, or engineer design this product, but the only thing I would like to see is a larger diameter sphere on the base... It would give you a larger range of motion.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great for improving balance and stability
customer_reviews.text: Great for improving balance and stability, there are many different ways to use it with results you can see and feel.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: It works great for my balance exercises
customer_reviews.text: it took me a while to get use to the texture on the board but now I don't even notice it. It works great for my balance exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. Just went through "major" ankle "surgery". This board is very similar to what I use at the physical therapy location I go to. It enables me to do this at home several times per day when not at the therapist.
customer_reviews.author: Rick V.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good rocker board. Be careful and watch what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband's physical therapist recommended this product to help maintain our best health -- great recommendation! My balance continues to be good, and I am mastering more challenging exercises.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Strunk

customer_reviews.title: but I think it does a good job anyway
customer_reviews.text: This is a little smaller than a rehab balance board, but I think it does a good job anyway. It seems to help improve balance.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil G Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Much better than the inflatable one I had previously. As someone else noticed, the base might be a little too wide as it's pretty easy to balance on. I use it while practicing hockey stick work though, so the movements are enough to make balancing more difficult. The only real drawback I've found is using it barefoot, which is really the only way to use a balance board. The pattern on the platform hurts my feet after a couple of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: SRT

customer_reviews.title: Meets My Need
customer_reviews.text: I can do all sorts of brain training balance exercises in conjunction with a weighted ball. I have seen a difference. Good product, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product with children to help them balance and shift their weight. It has a bumpy texture, so that helps them not slide off of it. It is lightweight and durable. It has just the right amount of tilt to challenge them and help them shift their weight.
customer_reviews.author: shasta mama

customer_reviews.title: Finally have one at home!
customer_reviews.text: used this at my physical therapist and found it to be very helpful in keeping the muscles in my calves loosened.. Now with it in my house, no more muscle cramps at 2 am.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I used in physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: Just like the one I used in physical therapy. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I can already tell great progress with my balance by using this. It is sturdy and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to have at a standing desk
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day at my desk. Great to have at a standing desk.
customer_reviews.author: Micaela Tucker

customer_reviews.title: INADEQUATE
customer_reviews.text: Surface area of this model is not large enough to allow proper balance motion.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the square rocker board for workouts to help plantar facitis and senior balance problems. The board is pricey but unbreakable and you probably can't build it yourself. And it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Slippery..
customer_reviews.text: I order the rocker board for my home exercises for plantar fasciitis. It appeared to be the same as the one I used at pt. I only rated it 3 stars because the surface is quite slippery. I thought it would have more of a rubbery grip to it. I haven't decided if I will keep it yet. The size is perfect for men or women.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Only one board not two!
customer_reviews.text: Picture and verbage imply you got both the rocker and wobble board but only the rocker shows up though the included instructions also show both. Returning - too much for just one board and was misleading!
customer_reviews.author: CodeSlinger

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: Exactly like the one I use in physical therapy. Love having it home.
customer_reviews.author: happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Rehab tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I use the tetra-Band Rocker Board as a rehab tool , since breaking my left hip and femur back in mid-February. The board is everything that I asked for and hasn't disappointed me. The unit is quite while rocking back and forth and side ways and the treads are great for preventing me from slipping off.
customer_reviews.author: John M Howell

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this. Very sturdy and well made, but it could be wider. That is my only complaint, the width, meaning not leaving too much room for both feet to fit on it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent add to my exercise equip
customer_reviews.text: In the pic it is the square one. Excellent add to my exercise equip. Follow guidance provided and one will strengthen as needed and safely.
customer_reviews.author: Frigate

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to help with therapy following ankle surgery. It's helped improve my range of motion.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mize

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent condition, durable design. Easy to follow instructions included, with progression in challenges. Great tool for regaining balance.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what the PT suggested for my continued improvement after receiving a TAR (Total Ankle Replacement)
customer_reviews.author: Debora White

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and feels supportive enough to hold my weight.
customer_reviews.author: k.alex.cassady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a foot problem and this is great for me to do my stretches with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica!

customer_reviews.title: Rocker board
customer_reviews.text: I found the rocker board not to be challenging and therefore disappointing. Because of an accident I have problems with my balance and thought this board would be helpful but I really should have saved my money. If it has higher then there would be a challenge but it is too close to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently going through physio therapy for my left ankle and they use one of these in the clinic. I wanted one for home. It's a little smaller than I expected but it works for me and I take a woman's size 9 in shoes. If you have a larger foot you might want to consider a larger wobble board. I do really like that it comes with a booklet of exercises to complement the ones I already do. Overall great purchase for a pretty good price in comparison to other wobble boards. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: kittykat123

customer_reviews.title: Good Stretch and Balance Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works as it should. Costs much less than wooden ones. Surface is uncomfortable bare footed.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what my PT ordered for me to work with!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Like very much
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy yet light weight. Comes with training suggestions that are helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Bob  K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product great for all sorts of core and leg and foot exercises
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid product for strengthening the ankles and calves post-injury. Smooth movement and easily controlled if used on a carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Criticalthinker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product! I started using it right away in my business, my clients and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just great.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great device. I use it regularly. It came brand new. Terrific item.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Lippmann

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The square devise is very good but could be the 21" as with the professional devices.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Wobble Board
customer_reviews.text: This is the identical one used at my physical therapists office. It is perfect for strengthening my calve, thighs and it's helping with my balance.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great for your knees!
customer_reviews.text: I used the square rocker board at my physical therapy office and loved it. I have never been able to do squats without hurting my knees, no matter how good I thought my form. But using the rocker board, I can do squats and I know my form is correct. A bonus, my knees never hurt! I am doing squats for the first time in my life. The price may be high but compared to the other boards out there, it is actually cheaper! If this one is good enough for my physical therapist, it is good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: SRC2010

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Rocker Board arrived in excellent time and is as advertized. I am very pleased with the puchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I use at PT
customer_reviews.text: Great balance exercise, and easy to fit in. Super product. I would recommend this product to others looking to work on balance and ankle strengthening.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart J. Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: It works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this under my desk at work to help with my ankle therapy. It works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Chiarenza

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I weigh close to 200 lb and this product supports me with no problem, booklet has many exercises to help get the most use out of the rocker board
customer_reviews.author: Obadiah

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Board
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly as advertised and performs just as I hoped it would.. Great addition to my daily exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: bear

customer_reviews.title: He liked it more than the handmade one he uses
customer_reviews.text: I showed this to my physical therapist. He liked it more than the handmade one he uses.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Nemec

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered promptly and is living up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-designed at a  very reasonable price. Great for balance therapy.
customer_reviews.text: Half the cost of the wood version that you see at many stores for physical therapy or therapy clinics. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Garritano

customer_reviews.title: Rocker Board Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Product as expected. Included pamphlet with exercises starting with easy and getting more difficult as your balance improves. Great for calf stretches (not included in pamphlet).
customer_reviews.author: bah

customer_reviews.title: The ridges
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I am pleased with this product, the ridges are a little uncomfortable when doing the board with bare feet but other than that it's well put together.
customer_reviews.author: darienne v.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It didn't rock very much so I haven't been able to use it. The picture made it appear that it would rock more when standing on it
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: We love this rocker-board
customer_reviews.text: We love this rocker-board! It's not too difficult, but try standing on it for 30 seconds with one foot, and you have a good challenge and an excellent strengthening exercise! Even our grandson enjoys using it. It's good for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Good choice
customer_reviews.text: I used one in my therapy. I bought this one for home. It is great. Good choice, service and quality.!
customer_reviews.author: Luthier

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars says it all...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I need. Gives a great stretch for the leg muscles and ligaments. Really hits the spot....GREAT. Begins my day with a spring in my step
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Ther-band Wobble Baord is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I am a very active 48 year old with some chronic ankle issues. I purchased the Ther-Band Wobble board and the pain is in the past. Within days of using the product I felt the difference, now I use it for 3 to 5 minutes ever-other day for maintenance. Thanks Thera-Band
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the chiropractor and it worked so well I had to Order one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rocking rocker board
customer_reviews.text: Great way to rehab a broken foot and to work on one's balance and core strength
customer_reviews.author: Biker Lady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for rehabbing ankle and all types of balancing exercises for running
customer_reviews.author: boho23

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than a tread desk. This is what I stand on while working on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: islander

customer_reviews.title: Therapy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: Excelent is that I need very good item for exercise the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Patino Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Much  need device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on the advise of my physical therapist. It has been worth every penny I spent on it. I am having problems with balance and dizziness.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Rocker Board
customer_reviews.text: It was much smaller than what I had used in physical therapy and was almost to small to use. It is useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Wasmus

product_meta.title: TheraBand Rocker Board Stability and Balance Trainer, Lateral Balance Board for Physical Therapy, Core Strengthening, Injury Rehabilitation, Agility Improvement, Coordination Exercise, & Surf Training
product_meta.description: Style Name:Rocker BoardThe square TheraBand Rocker Board offers an unstable and sensory-stimulating surface designed to facilitate rehab, post-rehab conditioning, and fitness applications. The Rocker Board is made of black molded plastic with a specially-designed tactile surface on the top, and an anti-skid surface on the bottom.
feature_bullets: 13 1/8" x 14" with a 30° angle of deflection, this stability trainer provides a linear plane for balance training and core stability workouts
Durable and lightweight, made of black molded plastic with a specially-designed tactile surface on the top and an anti-skid surface on the bottom
Offers an unstable and sensory-stimulating surface that provides proprioceptive feedback during balance exercises, which helps with rehabilitation, post-rehab conditioning, and overall fitness
Allows for one, controlled plane of instability at a time, such as forward and reverse or side to side balance movements
Comes with illustrated instruction guide with over 37 exercises, great for integrating with other resistance and balance products like TheraBand Resistance Bands and Tubing, Soft Weights or FlexBar

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
